data.title: Ray Joseph, Jr. on LinkedIn: #oliverscholars
data.meta_description: I'm forever grateful to the Oliver Scholars Program. The list of reasons is long. Oliver helped me secure my first summer job at age 14. That first summer… | 19 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
As we enter commencement season 🎓, we’re reminded that these “impactful” moments in graduates' lives aren’t all created equal. At Impact Partners, we believe these are moments for real conversations 💬, not platitudes and mulling over the thing or news of the day (don’t get us wrong, we love that stuff…just not for this) 🗞️❌. One of the best, most substantive and authentic commencement speeches we’ve heard took place at the University School of Milwaukee’s 2022 Commencement speech (https://lnkd.in/dNUkwmBY) 🏫, and was given by our client Bruce K Lee, founder and CEO of Keebeck Wealth Management, a multi-family office that manages billions of dollars 💼💵 from some of the world’s largest and most prestigious family offices. Bruce has lived through and embraces adversity 💪. In his address, he speaks about how it isn't just about facing challenges, it's about building pathways 🛤️ to ascend and discover true strength and ultimately our potential. He discussed how every obstacle 🚧 teaches us resilience, every setback imparts wisdom 🦉, and every hardship you power through (never quit! 💥🛑) prepares us for the future. His success proves that perseverance isn't merely about enduring; it's about evolving into the person who can achieve the outcomes we desire 🌟. #StrengthThroughAdversity 💪 #PersevereAndProsper 🚀 #MultiFamilyOffice #FamilyOffice #FamilyWealth 💰 #FamilyLegacy 🌳

⚠️Only 6 days left to sign up for Wall Street Prep and Wharton Online’s Private Equity Certificate Program! 𝙆𝙚𝙮 𝙁𝙖𝙘𝙩𝙨: ——— 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗲: September 5 - October 27, 2023 (8 weeks) 𝗙𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁: Self Paced & Live Office Hours (8 hours/week) 𝗖𝗲𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗲: Issued by Wharton Online and Wall Street Prep 𝗦𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗼𝗿 𝗙𝗶𝗿𝗺𝘀: Blackstone, KKR, Carlyle and many others 𝗦𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗿𝘀: David Rubenstein, Steve Rattner, Martin Brand & many others 𝗖𝗹𝗼𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗖𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗻𝘆: Penn Club in NYC (attend live or virtually) 𝘿𝙞𝙨𝙘𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝘼𝙫𝙖𝙞𝙡𝙖𝙗𝙡𝙚: ——— You can use the code CHRISREILLY at checkout to save $300 off enrollment. 𝙄 𝙧𝙚𝙢𝙚𝙢𝙗𝙚𝙧 𝙝𝙤𝙬 𝙞𝙩 𝙛𝙚𝙡𝙩... ——— I learned PE the hard way: digging through Internet forums, cobbling together poorly-designed models, all without anyone to network with. This program would have been a game changer for me, and it's why I'm so thrilled to be a part of it: I remember how hard it was to access this elusive industry. So if you're serious about private equity, this is a no-brainer: a certificate from one of the most prestigious universities coupled with access to some of the biggest names in the industry. ⏭️𝗡𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽𝘀: 🔗Click this link to learn more about the program and also see reviews from former students → https://lnkd.in/etUxz7zz

As we enter commencement season 🎓, we’re reminded that these “impactful” moments in graduates' lives aren’t all created equal. At Impact Partners, we believe these are moments for real conversations 💬, not platitudes and mulling over the thing or news of the day (don’t get us wrong, we love that stuff…just not for this) 🗞️❌. One of the best, most substantive and authentic commencement speeches we’ve heard took place at the University School of Milwaukee’s 2022 Commencement speech (https://lnkd.in/dNUkwmBY) 🏫, and was given by our client Bruce K Lee, founder and CEO of Keebeck Wealth Management, a multi-family office that manages billions of dollars 💼💵 from some of the world’s largest and most prestigious family offices. Bruce has lived through and embraces adversity 💪. In his address, he speaks about how it isn't just about facing challenges, it's about building pathways 🛤️ to ascend and discover true strength and ultimately our potential. He discussed how every obstacle 🚧 teaches us resilience, every setback imparts wisdom 🦉, and every hardship you power through (never quit! 💥🛑) prepares us for the future. His success proves that perseverance isn't merely about enduring; it's about evolving into the person who can achieve the outcomes we desire 🌟. #StrengthThroughAdversity 💪 #PersevereAndProsper 🚀 #MultiFamilyOffice #FamilyOffice #FamilyWealth 💰 #FamilyLegacy 🌳

Should I walk?... When I completed the degree in July, I wondered if I should just collect the paper by mail and go on with my life like many of my peers did. All my years from school combined with the rigamorole of life suggested that ceremony was making it into too much. Yet, when I returned to school for my MBA years after completing my degree, I was motivated by three things: 1) every day at A Great Idea, I am working to elevate the nonprofit, healthcare, and education teams who trust us to bring the best in brand support and advocacy-building so learning the business basics that are impacted by and impact brand development makes me and AGI better partners, 2) as a small business owner who centers his own biography in activism, enhancing experience with the insights of this coursework assist in being smart, sustainable, and prepared to bring our best all the time, and 3) I believe in lifelong learning (and the celebration of it)... and recently, I was inspired by the sheer joy possible in continuing that journey as we worked on the strategy to bring Greenwich House's Lifelong Skills and Opportunities Center for seniors to life as well as many of our partner programs that recognize the power of education at every age (from RECE's commitment to equity-based early childhood education to Framework's ongoing expansive support of learners across the country to name a few). So, while I know a lot of adult learners step away from the moments to relish the results of late-night studying and reconnecting to some untapped skills like algebra (oh, that Corporate Finance class!), I invited friends to join me and got to walk amongst so many wonderful people of all ages to celebrate. It was a reminder for me (and I hope something for all of us) that these big and little moments are opportunities to be grateful to those around us whose support makes it possible (my friends, my family, my client partners!) to accept challenge and drive forward as well as the joy in being somewhere different as we go through (whether completing or not completing) the process. As we look ahead at a new year, I hope we all get to celebrate each other, celebrate ourselves, and welcome all to walk forward with growth, exploration, and discovery. That, indeed, feels like a great idea!

🐈 The proverbial cat is out of the proverbial bag: some heavy hitters have joined our community: Ares Management Corporation, Castlelake, GSK, Sixth Street, Bank of America, Cambridge Associates, Capstone Investment Advisors, Centerbridge Partners, L.P., Christie's, Informa, Mubadala Capital, National Grid, S&P Global and Rothschild & Co ✴️ The 10kIF cog has been spinning relentlessly to close out this year with a bang, via the introduction of our Corporate Membership Scheme. 🧗🏼♂️ Our work reaches beyond our (tireless) delivery of #paidinternship programmes. We're creating a community of change-makers, whose contributions to an overdue shift in UK work culture are sustained, impactful, and will be remained for generations to come. 🎫 Our Corporate Members are made up of those who both see and respond to, the urgency of our mission. Black and Disabled talent are everywhere—our work is to get them in the door, find incredible people to nurture there drive, and make an impact that reverberates across sectors, cities and workplaces. 🏆A huge shoutout to the Corporate Members who support us in making that happen, with a simple, yet incredibly meaningful act of commitment to The 10,000 Interns Foundation and our mission. #The10000InternsFoundation #DiversityEquityAndInclusion #BlackTalent #DisabledTalent #Internships
